channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-614] Unable to install demos redhat-012 kits
item.description:
This it inconsistent.

I say this problem earlier, then I reinstalled and I was able to run demos, now it happens every time.

osgi:install -s fab:mvn:org.jboss.fuse.examples/cbr/6.0.0.redhat-012

From log file

18:13:32,236 | INFO | l Console Thread | Console | 15 - org.apache.karaf.shell.console - 2.3.0.redhat-60012 | Exception caught while executing command

item.summary: Unable to install demos redhat-012 kits

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Going by the information in the log file, the container has become a Fabric-managed container while testing. At that point, the plain fab-osgi support got uninstalled. The Fabric agent can still install FABs as part of a profile installation, but you can no longer install those using a plain osgi:install. Even if we would reintroduce the URL handler and allow for those artifacts to be installed, any change to the Fabric profile for the container would uninstall the bundle again and only install what's defined in the profile.

Can this command give a warning that container is managed by fabric?

I'm not the only person who has been confused by this.

Similar issues have been reported in forums.
Should maybe just add fabric-bundle to the "default" profile really, that should fix it for fabric

Made sure fab is available in any jboss fuse distro (starting with minimal) in http://fusesource.com/forge/git/fuseenterprise.git/?p=fuseenterprise.git;a=commit;h=3f6984c3ef7daf2360f2f687588e6430a0172821 Thanks Stan for the suggestion
